timeBased.periodsRequired: Time-based shifts must have at least one working period
timeBased.noRequiredHours: Time-based shifts should not have required hours set

hoursOnly.noPeriods: Hours-only shifts should not have working periods
hoursOnly.requiredHours: Hours-only shifts must have valid required hours greater than 0
hoursOnly.maxHours: Required hours cannot exceed 24 hours per day
hoursOnly.noFlexibleHours: Flexible hours are not valid for hours-only shifts
hoursOnly.noGracePeriod: Grace period is not valid for hours-only shifts

periods.maxTwo: Shifts can have at most two working periods per day
periods.sameTime: Period {{period}} cannot have the same start and end time
periods.positiveHours: Period {{period}} must have positive working hours
periods.multipleNight: Cannot have multiple night periods in a single shift

flexible.maxBefore: Flex minutes before cannot exceed 8 hours (480 minutes)
flexible.maxAfter: Flex minutes after cannot exceed 8 hours (480 minutes)
flexible.noGracePeriod: Grace period is not allowed when flexible hours is enabled

gracePeriod.max: Grace period cannot exceed 2 hours (120 minutes)

checkInOut.conflict: Either check-in must be required or auto check-out must be enabled

workingDays.required: At least one working day must be selected

coreHours.required: Core hours start and end times must be set when core hours are enabled
coreHours.sameTime: Core hours start time must be different from end time
coreHours.outsidePeriods: Core hours must be within the defined shift periods

weeklyHours.positive: Required weekly hours must be greater than 0
weeklyHours.maxWeekly: Required weekly hours cannot exceed 168 hours per week
weeklyHours.coreHoursRequired: Core hours must be enabled when weekly hours are specified

nightShift.notWithHoursOnly: Night shift is not compatible with hours-only shift type

shiftType.timeBased: Fixed start and end times with defined working periods
shiftType.hoursOnly: Flexible timing requiring a specific number of hours per day

help.requiredHours: For hours-only shifts: total hours employee must work per day (max 24 hours)
help.checkInRequired: Whether employees must check-in for this shift (absence flagged if missing)
help.autoCheckOut: System automatically checks out employees at shift end time
help.flexibleHours: Allow check-in within a time window instead of exact start time
help.flexBefore: Minutes before start time when check-in is allowed (max 8 hours)
help.flexAfter: Minutes after start time when check-in is allowed (max 8 hours)
help.gracePeriod: Late check-in tolerance without penalty (max 2 hours)
help.nightShift: Night shifts span midnight when end time is earlier than start time
help.multiPeriod: Split shifts with up to 2 working periods (e.g., morning + evening)
help.workingDays: Select which days of the week this shift applies to
help.requiredWeeklyHours: Total hours an employee must work across the shift's work week (max 168 hours)
help.weeklyHoursCoreRequired: Core hours will be automatically enabled when weekly hours are set
help.coreHours: Define mandatory presence windows each working day
help.coreStart: Start time for mandatory presence during working days
help.coreEnd: End time for mandatory presence during working days
help.nightShiftDisabledHoursOnly: Night shift is not available for hours-only shift types
help.gracePeriodDisabledFlexible: Grace period is disabled when flexible hours are enabled

descriptions.todays_distribution: Visual breakdown of today's attendance status across all employees, showing present, absent, late, and overtime categories.
descriptions.weekly_trend: Track attendance patterns over the last 7 days to identify trends and anomalies in employee presence.
descriptions.monthly_overview: Comprehensive summary of monthly attendance metrics including present days, absences, late arrivals, and overtime.
descriptions.overtime_trend: Daily overtime hours progression throughout the month, helping identify peak overtime periods and workload patterns.
descriptions.attendance_distribution: Overall distribution of attendance statuses for the selected period, providing insights into workforce attendance behavior.
descriptions.attendance_trend: Historical attendance trend analysis showing how attendance rates have evolved over the selected timeframe.
descriptions.department_performance: Compare attendance rates across departments to identify high-performing teams and areas needing attention.

overtime.title: Overtime Configurations
overtime.subtitle: Manage overtime policies and calculation rules
overtime.createPolicySubtitle: Define new overtime calculation rules and settings
overtime.editPolicySubtitle: Modify overtime calculation rules and settings
overtime.editActiveWarningMessage: You are editing an active overtime policy. Changes will take effect immediately and may impact current calculations.
overtime.editNotImplemented: Edit functionality will be available soon
overtime.noConfigurationsMessage: Get started by creating your first overtime policy to define how overtime is calculated for your employees.
overtime.preShiftDescription: Allow overtime before scheduled shift start
overtime.postShiftDescription: Allow overtime after scheduled shift end
overtime.normalDayRateHelp: Overtime multiplier for regular working days
overtime.offDayRateHelp: Overtime multiplier for weekends and off days
overtime.considerFlexibleTimeHelp: Account for flexible working hours in overtime calculation
overtime.weekendAsOffDayHelp: Treat weekends as off days for overtime rate calculation
overtime.requireApprovalHelp: Overtime must be approved by supervisor
overtime.policyNotesHelp: Provide additional context about this overtime policy
overtime.enablePreShiftDescription: Allow overtime calculation for hours worked before the scheduled shift start time
overtime.enablePostShiftDescription: Allow overtime calculation for hours worked after the scheduled shift end time
overtime.normalDayRateDescription: Multiplier applied to base hourly rate for overtime worked on regular working days (e.g., 1.5 means 150% of normal rate)
overtime.publicHolidayRateDescription: Multiplier applied to base hourly rate for overtime worked on public holidays (typically higher than normal days)
overtime.offDayRateDescription: Multiplier applied to base hourly rate for overtime worked on employee's scheduled days off or weekends
overtime.minimumOvertimeDescription: Minimum number of minutes that must be worked before overtime calculation begins (prevents small time increments)
overtime.maxPreShiftHoursDescription: Maximum number of hours that can be counted as pre-shift overtime per day (0 = unlimited)
overtime.maxPostShiftHoursDescription: Maximum number of hours that can be counted as post-shift overtime per day (0 = unlimited)
overtime.gracePeriodDescription: Buffer time in minutes added to shift times before overtime calculation starts (accommodates minor delays)
overtime.roundingIntervalDescription: Round overtime minutes to nearest interval (e.g., 15 rounds to quarters: 8 minutes becomes 15, 23 minutes becomes 30)
overtime.roundingIntervalMinutesDescription: Round overtime minutes to nearest interval (e.g., 15 rounds to quarters: 8 minutes becomes 15, 23 minutes becomes 30)
overtime.gracePeriodMinutesDescription: Buffer time in minutes added to shift times before overtime calculation starts (accommodates minor delays)
overtime.minimumOvertimeMinutesDescription: Minimum number of minutes that must be worked before overtime calculation begins (prevents small time increments)
overtime.considerFlexibleTimeDescription: Account for flexible working hours when calculating overtime (may affect when overtime starts)
overtime.weekendAsOffDayDescription: Automatically treat Saturday and Sunday as off days for overtime rate calculation purposes
overtime.requireApprovalDescription: Require supervisor or manager approval before overtime hours are counted and paid
overtime.effectiveFromDescription: Date when this overtime policy becomes active and starts being used for calculations
overtime.effectiveToDescription: Optional end date for this policy. Leave empty for indefinite duration until manually changed
overtime.activatePolicyConfirmation: This will activate the selected overtime policy and deactivate any currently active policy. Are you sure?
overtime.deactivatePolicyConfirmation: This will deactivate the selected overtime policy. No overtime calculations will be performed. Are you sure?
overtime.deletePolicyConfirmation: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this overtime policy?

validation.minimumOvertimePositive: Minimum overtime minutes must be 0 or greater
validation.gracePeriodPositive: Grace period must be 0 or greater
validation.roundingIntervalPositive: Rounding interval must be greater than 0
validation.maxHoursPositive: Maximum hours must be 0 or greater
validation.effectiveToAfterFrom: Effective to date must be after effective from date
validation.atLeastOneOvertimeType: At least one overtime type must be enabled
validation.pleaseFix: Please fix the validation errors before submitting
validation.serverErrors: Please fix the errors and try again
